docs.snippet: SAN JUAN, P.R., Jan. 18-- Puerto Rico, known for its Casals Festival each June, has made a serious bid for another place on the world's cultural map with the first San Juan Biennial, presenting 700 graphic works by 180 artists from Latin America and...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R., Jan. 18-- Puerto Rico, known for its Casals Festival each June, has made a serious bid for another place on the world's cultural map with the first San Juan Biennial, presenting 700 graphic works by 180 artists from Latin America and the Caribbean. The exhibition opened Friday and will continue through March 15.
docs.abstract: 1st biennial opens; presents 700 graphic works by 180 artists from Latin Amer and Caribbean, including comprehensive show of graphics by late J C Orozco and L Homar, PR's leading artist; Gov Ferre, Museum of Modern Art dir W S Lieberman hail show; jury and prizewinners listed

headline.main: Art Biennial Opens in San Juan; $1,0OO Prizes Given 8 Latin Artists

docs.snippet: PRINCETON, N.J., Jan. 21  Citizens in key countries of the Western world predict that the United States will have the leading position in science and the strongest military forces in the years ahead, the Gallup organization reported today.
docs.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, N.J., Jan. 21 Citizens in key countries of the Western world predict that the United States will have the leading position in science and the strongest military forces in the years ahead, the Gallup organization reported today.
docs.abstract: Gallup poll in late '69 reveals citizens in 12 key Western countries predict US will hold leading position in science in yrs ahead; similar survey in '59 predicted that USSR would be leader at end of '60s; participating countries listed; current and '59 findings detailed

headline.main: POLL ABROAD SEES U.S. AS TOP NATION; Finds Most Believe It Leads in Science and Arms

docs.snippet: THE sixties have been difficult for Latin America, and it faces the seventies with negative factors predominant.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE sixties have been difficult for Latin America, and it faces the seventies with negative factors predominant.
docs.abstract: article discusses contrast between hopes and promises with which Latin Amer entered '60s and meager results at end of decade; situation at decade's end includes virtual break-up of Alliance for Progress with resulting stand-still in development, worsening of econ and soc problems and return to mil govt in several nations

headline.main: Point of View; Expansion Only a Hope For Latins Latin Expansion Just Hope

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay During the thirties a political party here promised voters large savings on gasoline by making highways run only downhill. The party's leaders gathered the biggest crowds and the fewest Votes.

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia After four years of preparation, five Andean countries took the first steps this month toward forming an economic common market.

docs.abstract: Moves by Bolivia, Chile, Ecuador and Peru to insure success of Andean Group common mkt discussed; members seek inclusion of Venezuela in mkt; 175 items to become tariff free by mid-Apr; illus
